title: Authors and Citation
text: Krantz S (2024). osmclass: Classify Open Street Map Features. R package version 0.1.3, https://sebkrantz.github.io/osmclass/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {osmclass: Classify Open Street Map Features},   author = {Sebastian Krantz},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://sebkrantz.github.io/osmclass/}, }

title: Classify Open Street Map Features
text: Functions classify Open Street Map (OSM) features meaningful functional analytical categories Designed OSM PBF files, e.g. https://download.geofabrik.de/, imported spatial data frames using sf::st_read(). classification consists list categories assigned certain OSM tags values, also specified list. Given layer OSM PBF file classification, main osm_classify() function returns classification data frame giving, feature, primary alternative categories (overlap) assigned, tag(s) value(s) matched . package also contains classification OSM features economic function, based Krantz (2023). Krantz, Sebastian, Mapping Africa’s Infrastructure Potential Geospatial Big Data, Causal ML, XAI (August 10, 2023). Available SSRN: https://www.ssrn.com/abstract=4537867

title: Classify Open Street Map Features
code: # Download OSM PBF file for Djibouti download.file("https://download.geofabrik.de/africa/djibouti-latest.osm.pbf",                destfile = "djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", mode = "wb")                # Import OSM data for Djibouti library(sf) st_layers("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf") points <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "points") lines <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "lines") polygons <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "multipolygons")  # Classify features using the included classifications library(osmclass) points_class <- osm_classify(points, osm_point_polygon_class) polygons_class <- osm_classify(polygons, osm_point_polygon_class) lines_class <- osm_classify(lines, osm_line_class)  # See what proportion of the data we have classified sum(points_class$classified)/nrow(points) sum(polygons_class$classified)/nrow(polygons) sum(lines_class$classified)/nrow(lines)  # Get some additional info for lines library(collapse) lines_info <- lines |> ss(lines_class$classified) |>   rsplit(lines_class$main_cat[lines_class$classified]) |>   get_vars(names(osm_line_info_tags), regex = TRUE)  lines_info <- Map(osm_tags_df, lines_info, osm_line_info_tags[names(lines_info)]) str(lines_info)  # Get 'other_tags' of points layer as list other_point_tags <- osm_other_tags_list(points$other_tags, values = TRUE) str(other_point_tags)

title: A Classification of OSM Features by Economic Function — classifications
text: classification, developed Krantz (2023), aims classify OSM features meaningful specific economic categories 'education', 'health', 'tourism', 'financial', 'shopping', 'transport', 'communications', 'industrial', 'residential', 'road', 'railway', 'pipeline', 'power', 'waterway' etc. Separate classifications developed points polygons (buildings) (33 categories), lines (11 categories), applied respective layers OSM PBF files, see osmclass-package example. classification optimized (terms tag choice order categories) assign sensible primary category features Africa OSM.

text: Classifies OSM features meaningful functional analytical categories, according supplied classification.

title: Classify OSM Features — osm_classify
Classify OSM Features — osm_classify
text: data imported layer OSM PBF file. Usually 'sf' data frame, geometry column unnecessary. Importantly, data frame 'other_tags' column OSM PBF formatting. classification 2-level nested list providing classification. layers list : See osm_point_polygon_class osm_line_class example classifications.

title: Classify OSM Features — osm_classify
text: data.table rows matching input frame columns classified logical. Whether feature classified .e. matched tag-value classification. main_cat character. first category feature assigned , depending order categories classification. main_tag character. tag matched main category. main_tag_value character. value matched . alt_cats character. Alternative (secondary) categories assigned, comma-separated multiple. alt_tags_values character. tags double-quoted values matched secondary categories, comma-separated multiple.

title: Classify OSM Features — osm_classify
text: necessary expand 'other_tags' column, e.g. using osm_tags_df(). osm_classify() efficiently searches content column without expanding .

title: Extract Tags as Columns from an OSM PBF Layer — osm_tags_df
code: # See Examples at ?osmclass for full examples  # Extracting tags of interest (some of which are inside 'other_tags') tags <- c("osm_id", "highway", "man_made", "name", "alt_name",           "description", "wikidata", "amenity", "tourism") head(osm_tags_df(djibouti_points, tags)) #>       osm_id         highway man_made            name alt_name description #>       <char>          <char>   <char>          <char>   <char>      <char> #> 1:  27565085            <NA>     <NA> Djibouti جيبوتي     <NA>        <NA> #> 2: 260937317 traffic_signals     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>        <NA> #> 3: 265054255 traffic_signals     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>        <NA> #> 4: 265065760 traffic_signals     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>        <NA> #> 5: 265071403 traffic_signals     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>        <NA> #> 6: 266529985            <NA>     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>        <NA> #>    wikidata amenity tourism #>      <char>  <char>  <char> #> 1:    Q3604    <NA>    <NA> #> 2:     <NA>    <NA>    <NA> #> 3:     <NA>    <NA>    <NA> #> 4:     <NA>    <NA>    <NA> #> 5:     <NA>    <NA>    <NA> #> 6:     <NA>    <NA>    <NA>  # Only keeping tags with at least 5\% non-missing head(osm_tags_df(djibouti_points, tags, na.prop = 0.05)) #>       osm_id man_made            name alt_name wikidata #>       <char>   <char>          <char>   <char>   <char> #> 1:  27565085     <NA> Djibouti جيبوتي     <NA>    Q3604 #> 2: 260937317     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>     <NA> #> 3: 265054255     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>     <NA> #> 4: 265065760     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>     <NA> #> 5: 265071403     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>     <NA> #> 6: 266529985     <NA>            <NA>     <NA>     <NA>

what: Classify Open Street Map Features — osmclass-package
title: Classify Open Street Map Features — osmclass-package
text: R package classify Open Street Map (OSM) features meaningful functional analytical categories. expects OSM PBF data, e.g. https://download.geofabrik.de/, imported data frames (e.g. using sf), well optimized deal large quantities OSM data.

title: Classify Open Street Map Features — osmclass-package
text: Main Function Classify OSM Features osm_classify() Auxiliary Functions Extract Information (Tags) OSM PBF Layers osm_other_tags_list()osm_tags_df()

title: Classify Open Street Map Features — osmclass-package
code: if (FALSE) { # Download OSM PBF file for Djibouti download.file("https://download.geofabrik.de/africa/djibouti-latest.osm.pbf",               destfile = "djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", mode = "wb")  # Import OSM data for Djibouti library(sf) st_layers("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf") points <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "points") lines <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "lines") polygons <- st_read("djibouti-latest.osm.pbf", "multipolygons")  # Classify features library(osmclass) points_class <- osm_classify(points, osm_point_polygon_class) polygons_class <- osm_classify(polygons, osm_point_polygon_class) lines_class <- osm_classify(lines, osm_line_class)  # See what proportion of the data we have classified sum(points_class$classified)/nrow(points) sum(polygons_class$classified)/nrow(polygons) sum(lines_class$classified)/nrow(lines)  # Get some additional info for lines library(collapse) lines_info <- lines |> ss(lines_class$classified) |>   rsplit(lines_class$main_cat[lines_class$classified]) |>   get_vars(names(osm_line_info_tags), regex = TRUE)  lines_info <- Map(osm_tags_df, lines_info, osm_line_info_tags[names(lines_info)]) str(lines_info)  # Get 'other_tags' of points layer as list other_point_tags <- osm_other_tags_list(points$other_tags, values = TRUE) str(other_point_tags)    # TIP: For larger OSM files, importing layers (esp. lines and polygons) at once # may not be feasible memory-wise. In this case, translating to GPKG and using # an SQL query for stepwise processing is helpful:  library(fastverse) library(sf)  # Get all Africa OSM (6 Gb) opt <- options(timeout = 6000) download.file("https://download.geofabrik.de/africa-latest.osm.pbf",               destfile = "africa-latest.osm.pbf", mode = "wb")  # GPKG is large (> 40 Gb) gdal_utils("vectortranslate", "africa-latest.osm.pbf", "africa-latest.gpkg")  # Get map layers: shows how many features per layer layers <- st_layers("africa-latest.gpkg") print(layers)  # Example: stepwise classifying lines, 1M features at a time N <- layers$features[layers$name == "lines"] int <- seq(0L, N, 1e6L) lines_class <- vector("list", length(int))  for (i in seq_len(length(int))) {   cat("\nReading Lines Chunk:", i, "\n")   temp = st_read("africa-latest.gpkg",                  query = paste("SELECT * FROM lines LIMIT 1000000 OFFSET", int[i]))   # Some pre-selection: removing residential roads   temp %<>% fsubset(is.na(highway) | highway %chin% osm_line_class$road$highway)   # Classifying   temp_class <- osm_classify(temp, osm_line_class)   lines_class[[i]] <- ss(temp_class, temp_class$classified, check = FALSE) }  # Combining lines_class <- rbindlist(lines_class) options(opt) }
